content.question:
​

All coordinates are approximate.

Moving from left to right:

The curve begins at (negative 1.5 comma 3).

The curve increases to a maximum at (negative 1.4 comma 6).

The curve decreases through (negative 1.25 comma 3) to a minimum at (negative 1.1 comma 0).

The curve increases through (negative 1 comma 3) to a maximum at (negative 0.9 comma 6).

The curve decreases through (negative 0.75 comma 3) to a minimum at (negative 0.6 comma 0).

The curve increases through (negative 0.5 comma 3) to a maximum at (negative 0.4 comma 6).

The curve decreases through (negative 0.25 comma 3) to a minimum at (negative 0.1 comma 0).

The curve increases through (0 comma 3) to a maximum at (0.4 comma 6).

This pattern continues and ends at (2.5 comma 3).

​The figure shows the graph of a periodic function <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> in the <math alttext="x y"><semantics><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>-plane. What is the frequency of <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Identify information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations to answer a question or construct a model, with and without technology.
